Description: Textile; mummy padding; irregular pad of bunched linen, undyed but now light buff to grey-brown in colour (some oily staining). Worn, hence bare threads. No woven features visible. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.22 ends per 10mm and weft c.10 picks per 10mm. One deliberately torn edge, others mainly broken.
Production date: 600 BC (circa - if it does indeed belong to Dr. Granville's mummy.)
Condition: Medium; dirty, but not as brittle as other pads in this group (EA 76007-76014) .
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville (by inference)
Acquisition notes: One of eight pads of cloth (EA 76007-76014), found together in a bundle and labelled in a 19th century hand as 'Mummy Compresses'. Wrapper and handwriting as those which accompanied other mummy wrappings from Dr A B Granville. These pieces are probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by Granville in 1821.
